These Terms of Use govern your use of the welysn.com website (‘the Website’) which is owned and operated by Lysn Pty Ltd (ACN 614 950 131) (‘we’, ‘us’, ‘our’, ‘Lysn’). By accessing and using the Website or by clicking ‘I Accept’ when signing up for a user account on the Website, you agree to be bound by, and responsible for complying with, these Terms of Use.
We may change these Terms of Use from time to time. Your use of the Website following any such change to the Terms of Use will confirm your acceptance of these changes.
Nature of Service
The service offered by Lysn is not an acute service. In cases of emergency, please contact public emergency services immediately by dialling “000” by telephone. We are not responsible for any loss, damage, cost, expense, action, claim, demand, proceeding, injury or liability suffered by any person as a result of a failure by that person or any other person to contact public emergency services.
If you are thinking about suicide, if you are considering taking actions that may cause harm to you or to others, if you feel that you or any other person may be in any danger, or if you have any medical emergency, you must immediately “000” and notify the relevant authorities. You can also contact Lifeline 24 hours a day on 13 11 14 or alternatively obtain resources from Lifeline on www.lifeline.org.au
states the reason for your concern/s; and

a description of it; and
a hyperlink to the specific page (if applicable).
20. Confidentiality
If you receive or encounter any information which a reasonable person would consider to be confidential in nature, you agree to contact us immediately at support@welysn.com.
21. Applicable Law
The Website is controlled from our offices in New South Wales. These Terms and Use will be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of New South Wales.
You irrevocably and unconditionally submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of New South Wales.
If any provision of these Terms of Use is found to be invalid or unenforceable by a court of law, such invalidity or unenforceability will not affect the remainder of these Terms of Use which will continue in full force and effect.
22. Contact
If you have any questions or concerns regarding these Terms of Use please contact us at support@welysn.com
If you are in crisis, suicidal or need immediate assistance please call 000, or your local emergency mental health service.
Designed to help your mental health and \n wellbeing; created by mental health professionals.
Stigma free help at your fingertips, without the \n need to worry about your privacy \n (and your data).
Learn skills to be the best version \n of yourself.
Find a professional and access online tools \n to help improve your mental health. \n
Lysn uses self-reported assessments to help clients better understand aspects of their mental health and wellbeing.
We’re sorry! Unable to proceed, please try again later.
No one will see your assessment results except your Lysn healthcare professional, unless you have provided permission.
Please take a moment to review your answers
I accept Lysn providing my results to the Lysn healthcare professional that I’m next booked with.
If you exit this assessment, your answers will not be saved.
Are you sure you want to logout?
Discuss the results during your next consultation. If you don’t currently have a consultation booked click the button below to find a psychologist.
Lysn can match you with licensed therapists.
Welcome! Take 20 seconds to check-in on how you\'re tracking today! This tool is designed to increase mindfulness and self-awareness.
Move the bar below to \n tell us how you feel
If you exit this well-being tracker, your answers will not be saved.
You do not have the required privileges to submit the well-being tracker.
If you go back, your answers will not be saved.
Lysn can help you find \n the right Psychologist

Research shows that taking the time to stop and check-in with yourself is a powerful and important life skill. It has many mental, physical, emotional and spiritual benefits. Checking-in is an act of mindfulness that increases self-awareness. 


When you take the time to ask yourself important questions about aspects of your life, you gain a better understanding of your current emotions, strengths, weaknesses, resilience and driving factors. 


With this gained self-awareness, you become empowered with insight about what parts of your life are keeping you strong and what areas you need to take action for positive change.


Scientists have also discovered that the simple act of practising mindfulness helps improve your overall health and wellbeing. Mindfulness can help improve mental health, relieve the physical impact of stress, treat heart disease, lower blood pressure, reduce chronic pain, improve sleep, and alleviate gastrointestinal difficulties.
